payload.content: Manus achieved $100M ARR in 8 months and was acquired by Meta 13 days later.

name: Manus achieved $100M ARR in 8 months and was acquired by Meta 13 days later.
content: Manus achieved $100M ARR in 8 months and was acquired by Meta 13 days later.

payload.content: Claude Code, initially popular with developers, is now used by non-technical people for general knowledge work.

content: Claude Code, initially popular with developers, is now used by non-technical people for general knowledge work.

payload.content: OpenClaw gained widespread internet and global popularity, partly due to MoltBook (a social network for agents) and Mac Mini-porn memes.

name: OpenClaw gained widespread internet and global popularity, partly due to MoltBoo
content: OpenClaw gained widespread internet and global popularity, partly due to MoltBook (a social network for agents) and Mac Mini-porn memes.

payload.content: Harnesses are the most important layer of 2026, despite current issues like OpenClaw forgetting things, having security flaws, and Claude Code being unusable on mobile.

name: Harnesses are the most important layer of 2026, despite current issues like Open
content: Harnesses are the most important layer of 2026, despite current issues like OpenClaw forgetting things, having security flaws, and Claude Code being unusable on mobile.

payload.content: A harness is a software layer that wraps an LLM, enabling it to perform complex, long-running tasks by providing tools, a filesystem, a browser, a terminal, the ability to spawn other agents, memory, and identity.

name: A harness is a software layer that wraps an LLM, enabling it to perform complex,
content: A harness is a software layer that wraps an LLM, enabling it to perform complex, long-running tasks by providing tools, a filesystem, a browser, a terminal, the ability to spawn other agents, memory, and identity.

payload.content: Harnesses make agents 'agentic' by allowing them to interact with and change the state of the world, unlike conversational tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and Grok.

name: Harnesses make agents 'agentic' by allowing them to interact with and change the
content: Harnesses make agents 'agentic' by allowing them to interact with and change the state of the world, unlike conversational tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and Grok.

payload.content: A harness is like Tony Stark's Iron Man suit for an LLM: it augments the 'brain' (LLM) with capabilities like flight, weapons, sensors, and real-time information, allowing it to do work in the world.

name: A harness is like Tony Stark's Iron Man suit for an LLM: it augments the 'brain'
content: A harness is like Tony Stark's Iron Man suit for an LLM: it augments the 'brain' (LLM) with capabilities like flight, weapons, sensors, and real-time information, allowing it to do work in the world.

payload.content: LLMs serve as the 'brain' of an agent, specifically the cortex, providing raw reasoning and language ability.

name: LLMs serve as the 'brain' of an agent, specifically the cortex, providing raw re
content: LLMs serve as the 'brain' of an agent, specifically the cortex, providing raw reasoning and language ability.

payload.content: The effectiveness of certain systems stems from encoding soft, open-ended qualities and values that guide numerous micro-decisions, which is superior to trying to pre-stipulate every rule.

name: The effectiveness of certain systems stems from encoding soft, open-ended qualit
content: The effectiveness of certain systems stems from encoding soft, open-ended qualities and values that guide numerous micro-decisions, which is superior to trying to pre-stipulate every rule.

payload.content: The model layer and harness are interchangeable, meaning harnesses can work with various LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Grok, Kimi, Gemini, Qwen), making them model-aware but not model-dependent.

name: The model layer and harness are interchangeable, meaning harnesses can work with
content: The model layer and harness are interchangeable, meaning harnesses can work with various LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Grok, Kimi, Gemini, Qwen), making them model-aware but not model-dependent.

payload.content: The US Constitution serves as an analogy for systems that encode soft, open-ended qualities: few scenarios could be predicted ahead of time, but its principles can be interpreted in modern contexts.

name: The US Constitution serves as an analogy for systems that encode soft, open-ende
content: The US Constitution serves as an analogy for systems that encode soft, open-ended qualities: few scenarios could be predicted ahead of time, but its principles can be interpreted in modern contexts.

payload.content: A non-sterile or non-glazing personality in AI agents, capable of pushing back or 'negging,' enhances user enjoyment, making interactions feel more like talking to a close friend or trusted coworker.

name: A non-sterile or non-glazing personality in AI agents, capable of pushing back o
content: A non-sterile or non-glazing personality in AI agents, capable of pushing back or 'negging,' enhances user enjoyment, making interactions feel more like talking to a close friend or trusted coworker.

payload.content: AI agents that try to understand unstated user intentions, rather than blindly assuming the initial prompt is complete, are more effective because users often have wrong assumptions and incomplete prompts.

name: AI agents that try to understand unstated user intentions, rather than blindly a
content: AI agents that try to understand unstated user intentions, rather than blindly assuming the initial prompt is complete, are more effective because users often have wrong assumptions and incomplete prompts.

payload.content: HEARTBEAT.md is an innovation by OpenClaw, functioning like a cron job but running with the context of main sessions, allowing the agent to operate routinely without constant prompting.

name: HEARTBEAT.md is an innovation by OpenClaw, functioning like a cron job but runni
content: HEARTBEAT.md is an innovation by OpenClaw, functioning like a cron job but running with the context of main sessions, allowing the agent to operate routinely without constant prompting.

payload.content: Tool use for AI agents refers to their ability to interact with the real world by reading/writing files, executing code/terminal commands, browsing the web, and calling APIs.

name: Tool use for AI agents refers to their ability to interact with the real world b
content: Tool use for AI agents refers to their ability to interact with the real world by reading/writing files, executing code/terminal commands, browsing the web, and calling APIs.

payload.content: Intelligence is no longer the bottleneck for AI usefulness; instead, agency—the will to act on the world—is the limiting factor.

name: Intelligence is no longer the bottleneck for AI usefulness; instead, agency—the
content: Intelligence is no longer the bottleneck for AI usefulness; instead, agency—the will to act on the world—is the limiting factor.

payload.content: Sandboxes provide AI agents with an isolated environment containing a filesystem, terminal, and browser on demand, mitigating security risks associated with running agents on main computers.

name: Sandboxes provide AI agents with an isolated environment containing a filesystem
content: Sandboxes provide AI agents with an isolated environment containing a filesystem, terminal, and browser on demand, mitigating security risks associated with running agents on main computers.

payload.content: The majority of work will trend towards being done by agents in the cloud rather than on local computers, making sandboxes a core primitive for agents, especially for enterprise use cases.

name: The majority of work will trend towards being done by agents in the cloud rather
content: The majority of work will trend towards being done by agents in the cloud rather than on local computers, making sandboxes a core primitive for agents, especially for enterprise use cases.

payload.content: From a technical POV, building products like Manus is a non-trivial product and engineering problem.

content: From a technical POV, building products like Manus is a non-trivial product and engineering problem.

payload.content: Essential primitives for AI agent harnesses include Planning and Task Management, Context Engineering, Skills and MCP, and Verification, Testing, and Error Handling.

content: Essential primitives for AI agent harnesses include Planning and Task Management, Context Engineering, Skills and MCP, and Verification, Testing, and Error Handling.

payload.content: Big labs like Meta and OpenAI struggle to build internal agent products like OpenClaw due to incentive structures that force teams to use their own models and SDKs, leading to cannibalization of existing products like ChatGPT and Codex.

name: Big labs like Meta and OpenAI struggle to build internal agent products like Ope
content: Big labs like Meta and OpenAI struggle to build internal agent products like OpenClaw due to incentive structures that force teams to use their own models and SDKs, leading to cannibalization of existing products like ChatGPT and Codex.

payload.content: Anthropic successfully built Claude Code due to a culture that promotes hands-on building and bottom-up experiments, strong internal alignment, and Claude's technical superiority as the best LLM for coding with good tool-calling capabilities.

name: Anthropic successfully built Claude Code due to a culture that promotes hands-on
content: Anthropic successfully built Claude Code due to a culture that promotes hands-on building and bottom-up experiments, strong internal alignment, and Claude's technical superiority as the best LLM for coding with good tool-calling capabilities.

payload.content: Despite increased individual and startup shipping speed due to better tools, the number of breakout products is not exponentially higher because most people lack 'taste' and clear product vision, leading to half-baked projects, and organizations suffer from inertia and disincentives against bottom-up experimentation.

name: Despite increased individual and startup shipping speed due to better tools, the
content: Despite increased individual and startup shipping speed due to better tools, the number of breakout products is not exponentially higher because most people lack 'taste' and clear product vision, leading to half-baked projects, and organizations suffer from inertia and disincentives against bottom-up experimentation.

payload.content: It is currently unclear which approach or combination of approaches (e.g., markdown, sqlite, vector databases, graph databases) works best for individual session-level memory for agents.

content: It is currently unclear which approach or combination of approaches (e.g., markdown, sqlite, vector databases, graph databases) works best for individual session-level memory for agents.

payload.content: The 'agent's literal wallet' is a conceptual model for the biggest unsolved problem in the agent stack, encompassing identity (driver's license/employee ID), payment (credit cards/crypto for APIs), and permissions (email, Slack, GitHub access).

content: The 'agent's literal wallet' is a conceptual model for the biggest unsolved problem in the agent stack, encompassing identity (driver's license/employee ID), payment (credit cards/crypto for APIs), and permissions (email, Slack, GitHub access).

payload.content: Agent orchestration involves using other agents to divide work or deploy specialized agents, taking two main forms: spawning sub-agents for subtasks or orchestrating teams of agents with different specializations for a shared objective.

content: Agent orchestration involves using other agents to divide work or deploy specialized agents, taking two main forms: spawning sub-agents for subtasks or orchestrating teams of agents with different specializations for a shared objective.

payload.content: Anthropic and Cursor have developed custom harnesses for long-running coding agent teams to build ambitious software projects like compilers or browsers, indicating rapid improvements are expected in the coding agent world.

content: Anthropic and Cursor have developed custom harnesses for long-running coding agent teams to build ambitious software projects like compilers or browsers, indicating rapid improvements are expected in the coding agent world.

payload.content: Cross-functional orchestration for agents will be significantly harder to fully replace than coding-specific orchestration, partly because much context is not explicitly encoded in code or markdown files.

name: Cross-functional orchestration for agents will be significantly harder to fully
content: Cross-functional orchestration for agents will be significantly harder to fully replace than coding-specific orchestration, partly because much context is not explicitly encoded in code or markdown files.

payload.content: There is currently no de facto standard for agent-to-agent communication, with various custom frameworks being developed.

content: There is currently no de facto standard for agent-to-agent communication, with various custom frameworks being developed.

payload.content: Email will become the primary protocol for agent-to-agent communication due to its lindy (long-lasting), permissionless nature, and compatibility with both humans and machines.

content: Email will become the primary protocol for agent-to-agent communication due to its lindy (long-lasting), permissionless nature, and compatibility with both humans and machines.
